Key Match Events: The Guardians walked off the Twins in extra innings for the second straight game.
Cleveland clinched a playoff berth with this victory.
Simeon Woods Richardson pitched 4.2 innings with 6 strikeouts.
The Twins offense struggled, managing only two runs (one earned) on three hits and three walks against Cleveland's starter Joe Cantillo.
The Twins had zero hits and just one walk over 6 2/3 innings against Cleveland's bullpen.
In the top of the 10th inning, Kyle Farmer was the Manfred Man, and Willi Castro laid down a sacrifice bunt.
Post-Match Reflections: The Twins are now tied with the Detroit Tigers for the final wild card spot in the American League.
The Twins head to Boston to try to turn things around.
The Twins have the tiebreaker over the Tigers, Mariners, and Royals, making the upcoming series in Boston crucial.
